item.title: GitHub SSH Setup (Linux)
item.description:
âœ… Prerequisites A Linux system (Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora, Arch, etc.)

Access to a terminal

OpenSSH installed (usually preinstalled)

  1. ðŸ§° Generate a New SSH Key In your terminal, run:

ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C “your_email@example.com” If ed25519 is not supported, use:

ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C “your_email@example.com” When prompted: Save location: Press Enter to use the default (/home/youruser/.ssh/id_ed25519)

Passphrase: (optional but recommended) Enter a secure passphrase

  1. ðŸ”‘ Add Your SSH Key to the SSH Agent Start the agent (if itâ€™s not running):

eval “$(ssh-agent -s)” Add your key:

item.title: GitHub SSH Setup (Windows)
item.description:
Follow these steps to generate and use SSH keys on Windows for secure access to remote servers and services like GitHub, GitLab, or your own SSH server.

âœ… Prerequisites

  • Windows 10 or later

  • Access to Command Prompt or PowerShell

  • Git for Windows (includes ssh and ssh-keygen)

1. ðŸ§° Generate a New SSH Key

Open your terminal and run:

ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"

If your system doesnâ€™t support ed25519, use:
